name: Core freakouts
list:
Don't
Panic

EVERYBODY is freaking out about this stuff (don't you read the news?). Hang in there.
(Before you know it, you'll understand this stuff as well as most of us do)

Don't
Panic

Insert pithy yet amazingly perceptive and relevant Douglas Adams joke here
I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
This must be Thursday. I never could get the hang of Thursdays.
Flying is learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.
A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that'.
Would it save [...] a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?

Don't
Panic

Reality is frequently inaccurate

Don't
Panic

He attacked everything in life with a mix of extraordinary genius and naive incompetence, and it was often difficult to tell which was which.

Don't you understand that we need to be childish in order to understand? Only a child sees things with perfect clarity, because it hasn't developed all those filters which prevent us from seeing things that we don't expect to see?

Don't
Panic

We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works

Don't
Panic

There's an infinite number of monkeys outside who want to talk to us about this script for Hamlet they've worked out..

Don't
Panic

The impossible often has a kind of integrity to it which the merely improbable lacks.

Don't
Panic

They are a dreamer, a thinker, a speculative philosopher... or, as their spouse would have it, an idiot.

Don't
Panic

Exactly! [...] So once you do know what the question actually is, you'll know what the answer means.

Don't
Panic

See first, think later, then test. But always see first. Otherwise you will only see what you were expecting. Most scientists forget that.

Don't
Panic

we’ll be saying a big hello to all intelligent life forms everywhere ... and to everyone else out there, the secret is to bang the rocks together, guys.
Ow! My brains!

Don't
Panic

Let the past hold on to itself and let the present move forward into the future.

Don't
Panic

The major difference between a thing that might go wrong and a thing that cannot possibly go wrong is that when a thing that cannot possibly go wrong goes wrong it usually turns out to be impossible to get at or repair.
